Problem:
class WeatherSystem { constructor() { this.temperature = 20; this.humidity = 50; } increaseHeat(units) { this.temperature += units; if (this.temperature > 25) { this.humidity += 5; } } decreaseHumidity(percent) { this.humidity -= this.humidity * (percent / 100); if (this.humidity < 45) { this.temperature -= 3; } } }",

Can actively decreasing humidity induce a temperature reduction?
Explanation: Actively invoking decreaseHumidity can lower humidity significantly, and if humidity drops below 45%, the condition within the method triggers a temperature reduction by 3 degrees. Thus, through intervention by reducing humidity, temperature can be indirectly decreased.
